To the same bowl, add the pineapple, mayo, yogurt, curry powder, and mustard. Stir to combine.","4. To assemble the sandwich, begin with a slice of your favourite bread. Layer it with lettuce, tomato slices, the mushroom curry mixture, and top it with some green onions. Enjoy!"]
883.title: Oyster Mushroom Curry Salad Sandwich

884.ingredients: [1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 4cloves garlic, thinly sliced, 2medium onions, chopped , 1red hot chili, minced, 1medium carrot, finely chopped, 1roasted red bell pepper from a jar, chopped, ½ tspsalt, 2 tsp(6 g)ground cumin, 1 tsp(2 g)smoked sweet paprika powder, 1 tsp(2 g)ground coriander, 3⅓cups(800 mL)canned crushed tomatoes, 2cups(328 g)cooked chickpeas, ½cupkalamata olive, chopped, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)tahini, 2 tsp(10 mL)sodium-reduced soy sauce, ⅛ tspground black pepper, 2cups(60 g)fresh spinach, finely chopped, fresh cilantro, lemon slices, cooked rice, naan, toasted pita bread]
884.recipe: ["1. To a large pan on high heat, add the oil, garlic, onion, chilli, carrot, bell pepper, and salt. Cook for 7 minutes.","2. Add the cumin, paprika, and coriander, and cook for 1 minute more to toast the spices.","3. Then add the tomatoes, chickpeas, olives, tahini, soy sauce, and pepper. Reduce the heat to medium, cover, and cook for 5 minutes.","4. Then add the spinach. When wilted, remove from the heat. Garnish and serve alongside pita bread or rice. Enjoy!"]
884.title: One-Pot Tomato & Chickpea Stew

885.ingredients: [4medium potatoes, cut into 1 cm cubes, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 1 tsp(2 g)onion powder, ½ tsppaprika powder, ½ tspdried rosemary, ¼ tspsalt, ¼ tspground black pepper, 20cherry tomatoes, on the vine, 1 tsp(5 mL)vegetable oil, 22.9 oz(650 g)firm tofu, pressed, ½ tspsalt, ¼ tspground turmeric, ¼ tspground black pepper, ½cup(120 mL)vegan mayonnaise, 1 tsp(2 g)curry powder, 1stalk green onion, 2 tsp(10 mL)vegetable oil, 8cloves garlic, minced, 10cups(300 g)fresh spinach, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)sodium-reduced soy sauce, 1 tsp(5 mL)sambal oelek, 1avocado, quartered]
885.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 390°F (200°C). Add the potatoes to a baking tray and drizzle over the oil. Toss to coat.","2. Then sprinkle over the onion powder, paprika, rosemary, salt, and pepper, and toss again.","3. Bake for 20 minutes, then stop to stir. At this point, also add the vine of tomatoes to the tray to bake with the potatoes. Return to the oven for another 20 - 25 minutes, or until golden.","4. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large pan on medium-high. Crumble in the tofu with your hands. Cook for 5 - 7 minutes, stirring throughout. The aim is to get the tofu soft and spongy, but not too crispy.","5. Then add in the salt, turmeric, and pepper, and cook for an additional 1 - 2 minutes while stirring, so that the spices toast.","6. Remove from the heat, and transfer the tofu to a bowl. Add in the mayo and curry powder, and stir well.","7. Thinly slice the entire stalk of green onion. The white bottom part of the onion can be further minced and then stirred into the \"egg\" salad mixture. The sliced green part of the onion can be reserved for garnish.","8. For the garlic spinach, heat the oil in a large pan on medium-high. When hot, add the garlic and cook until golden, about 4 - 5 minutes.","9. Then add all the spinach, soy sauce, and sambal. Cook for another minute, or until the spinach is wilted.","10. Serve each component of the meal in bowls, alongside some avocado. Enjoy!"]
885.title: Vegan "Egg" Salad Breakfast Bowl

886.ingredients: [1½cups(300 g)uncooked white rice, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 3cups(516 g)cooked black beans, 2 tsp(5 g)chili powder, 2 tsp(6 g)garlic powder, 2 tsp(5 g)onion powder, 2 tsp(5 g)paprika powder, 2 tsp(6 g)ground cumin, ½ tspground black pepper, ½ tspsalt, ¼cup(60 mL)extra virgin olive oil, 2limes, juiced , 2cloves garlic, crushed, 2 tsp(5 g)paprika powder, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, ½ tspground black pepper, 1 tsp(6 g)salt, 2cups(330 g)canned corn, 2red bell peppers, diced, 1small red onion, diced, 2avocados, diced†, 2cups(360 g)cherry tomatoes, halved, ¼cup(38 g)pickled jalapeño slices, fresh cilantro]
886.recipe: ["1. Cook the rice according to the package instructions. Once cooked, let cool off completely.","2. To a large pan over medium-high heat, add the oil, beans, and spices. Cook for 3 - 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Remove from the heat and let the beans cool off completely.","3. Make the dressing by mixing all ingredients in a bowl.","4. To assemble the mason jar, start with dividing the dressing between the jars. Then add the rice at the base, followed by the beans, corn, bell pepper, red onion, avocado, tomatoes. Top with the jalapeño slices.","5. When ready to devour, give it a good mix. Enjoy!"]
886.title: Spiced Black Bean & Rice Salad in a Jar

887.ingredients: [1 Tbsp(15 mL)olive oil, 1medium onion, chopped, 2cloves garlic, minced, 1 tsp(6 g)salt, ½ tspground black pepper, 1 tsp(2 g)smoked sweet paprika powder, 1 tsp(1 g)dried thyme, ½ tspground cumin, ½ tspdried oregano, ½ tspcayenne pepper, 2medium tomatoes, diced, 1red bell pepper, thinly sliced , 1½cups(308 g)uncooked Spanish paella rice, 4cups(960 mL)boiling water, 2vegetable bouillon cubes, 1 pinchsaffron threads (optional, but recommended), 1cup(134 g)frozen green peas, 1½cups(255 g)canned artichoke hearts, chopped, lemon slices]
887.recipe: ["1. Add the oil to a large pan* or paella pan over medium-high heat. When hot, add the onion, garlic, salt, and pepper. Cook this for 3 minutes.","2. Then add the paprika, thyme, cumin, oregano, and cayenne. Cook while stirring for 30 - 60 seconds to toast the spices.","3. Add in the tomatoes and bell pepper (reserving a few slices for garnish, if desired). Cook for 2 - 3 minutes.","4. Then, add the paella rice, toasting this for 1 - 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.","5. In a large jug, mix the boiling water and bouillon so that the cubes dissolve**.","6. Add the liquid and saffron to the pan, and bring to a rapid simmer for 2 minutes. Then reduce to a gentle simmer and cook uncovered for 20 - 30 minutes, or until the rice is tender. Avoid stirring the rice while it cooks.","7. When the liquid has been absorbed by the rice, taste-test. Try the rice on the outer-most part of the pan, as that's the rice that will cook last given it's furthest away from the heat source. If the rice is firm but tender, it's ready. Otherwise, add a splash of boiling water or hot stock, and let it continue to cook until the rice is cooked through.","8. When the rice is cooked, add the peas and half of the artichokes. Gently stir it in, then add the remaining artichokes on top, along with the reserved bell pepper slices.","9. Remove the pan from the heat, cover with a lid, and let the paella rest for 10 minutes. Do not skip this step, as it makes all the difference in the taste and texture of the rice.","10. Remove the lid, garnish, and enjoy!"]
887.title: Vegan Paella: Spanish-Inspired Rice

888.ingredients: [1½cups(285 g)uncooked brown rice, soaked overnight†, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned light coconut milk, 6cardamom pods, cracked (optional), 1vegetable bouillon cube, crushed , 1medium broccoli, cut into bite-sized pieces , 1medium onion, cut into bite-sized pieces , 2parsnips, cut into bite-sized pieces , 1½cups(297 g)cooked brown lentils, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)olive oil, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, 1 tsp(3 g)garlic powder, 1 tsp(2 g)onion powder, ½ tspsalt, ½ tspground black pepper, ¼ tspcayenne pepper, ½lime, juiced, ⅓cup(80 mL)tahini, ¼cup(60 mL)water, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)sambal oelek, 2 tsp(10 mL)sodium-reduced soy sauce, 2 tsp(10 mL)agave syrup, ½ tsponion powder, lime slices, medium carrot, red bell pepper, roasted almonds]
888.recipe: ["1. To a medium pot, add the rice, coconut milk, cardamom, and bouillon. Stir, bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook covered until the rice is tender and all the liquid has been absorbed about 15 - 20 minutes.","2. Preheat the oven to 390°F (200°C). To a parchment-lined baking tray, add the broccoli, onion, parsnip, lentils, oil, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper, and cayenne pepper. Toss together, and spread out evenly.","3. Bake on the centre rack of the oven for 20 minutes, stirring once halfway.","4. When cooked, remove the rice from heat. Fluff with a fork, remove the cardamom pods, cover with a lid, and let rest for 5 minutes.","5. Prepare the sauce by combining the lime juice, tahini, water, sambal, soy sauce, agave syrup, and onion powder in a mason jar. Shake or stir to combine into a smooth sauce.","6. To assemble, layer rice on the bottom of a bowl. Top with a generous heap of roasted vegetables and lentils. Add some (optional) fresh cut-up veggies of your choosing, drizzle the tahini sambal sauce on top, and enjoy!"]
888.title: Coconut Roasted Lentil Nourish Bowl

889.ingredients: [2cups(328 g)cooked chickpeas, 1cup(134 g)frozen green peas, 2cloves garlic, 1lemon, juiced , 1stalk green onion, ¼cup(4 g)fresh parsley, ¼cup(8 g)fresh mint leaves (optional), 2 Tbsp(30 mL)tahini, 2 Tbsp(17 g)all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting, 2 Tbsp(14 g)ground flaxseeds, 2 tsp(6 g)ground cumin, 2 tsp(3 g)whole coriander seeds, ¼ tspcayenne pepper, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)olive oil, hummus, vegan tzatziki]
889.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 390°F (200°C) and line a baking tray.","2. Drain and rinse the chickpeas if from a jar or can, and dry well using a kitchen cloth.","3. Rinse the frozen peas with warm water until defrosted. Then using your hands, squeeze as much liquid out of the peas as possible.","4. Add all the ingredients except for the olive oil to a food processor and blend until smooth. Let the mixture sit for 5 to firm up.","5. Scoop up 1 Tbsp of the mixture at a time and shape into small patties. Coat your hands with a bit of flour to keep the mixture from sticking*.","6. Dust both sides of the formed patties with flour, and then brush a generous amount of oil on both sides as well.","7. Place on the prepared baking tray, then bake in the centre rack of the preheated oven until golden, about 30 minutes, giving the patties a flip once halfway. Enjoy the patties in a wrap, nourish bowl, or salad."]
889.title: Baked Green Pea & Chickpea Falafels

890.ingredients: [2medium eggplants, 1 tsp(5 mL)olive oil, 1 tsp(6 g)salt, 2 tsp(10 mL)vegetable oil, 1medium onion, diced, 3cloves garlic, minced, 2 tsp(6 g)ground cumin, 2 tsp(4 g)ground coriander, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cinnamon, 1bell pepper, diced, 1⅔cups(400 g)canned diced tomatoes, 1cup(198 g)cooked brown lentils, ¼cup(32 g)dried apricots, diced, ½ tspsalt, ¼ tspground black pepper, ¾cup(180 mL)unsweetened coconut yogurt, 5fresh mint leaves, thinly sliced, cooked rice, naan]
890.recipe: ["1. Preheat oven to 390°F (200°C). Cut each eggplant in half lengthwise and cut cross-hatches into the flesh*. Sprinkle each side with ¼ tsp of oil and ¼ tsp salt and rub in.","2. Place the eggplant on a parchment-lined baking tray and bake for 20 minutes, until the eggplant can easily be pierced with a fork.","3. When fully roasted, remove from the oven, and when cool enough to handle, use a spoon to scrape out the cooked middle, discarding the skin. While the eggplant is roasting, prepare the curry.","4. Heat the oil in a large pot on medium-high heat. Sauté the onions until soft, about 3 - 5 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pot.","5. Add the garlic, cumin, coriander, and cinnamon and sauté until fragrant, about a minute.","6. Add the bell pepper, tomatoes, lentils, apricots, salt, pepper, and roasted eggplant. Heat through until the bell peppers are soft but still crunchy.","7. To serve, we highly recommend garnishing it with coconut yogurt, mint, and lemon as the flavours really help to elevate the curry. Enjoy!"]
890.title: Eggplant & Lentil Apricot Curry

891.ingredients: [2 tsp(10 mL)vegetable oil, 2 tsp(4 g)whole cumin seeds, 2 tsp(3 g)whole coriander seeds, 2 tsp(4 g)whole brown mustard seeds (optional), 1medium onion, diced, 3cloves garlic, minced, 1 Tbsp(6 g)freshly grated ginger, 1vegetable bouillon cube, crushed , 1 Tbsp(5 g)garam masala, 2 tsp(6 g)ground turmeric, ½ tspcayenne pepper, 3medium potatoes, cut into 1 cm cubes, 1½cups(360 mL)water, 1cup(134 g)frozen green peas, 1½cups(246 g)cooked chickpeas, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, 2cups(60 g)fresh spinach, cooked rice, fresh cilantro, lime slices, naan]
891.recipe: ["1. To a large pot on medium-high heat, add the oil. When hot, add the cumin, coriander, and mustard seeds, stirring for 1 minute to toast the spices.","2. Then add the onion and cook for 3 - 5 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pot.","3. Then add the garlic and ginger, and cook for 2 more minutes.","4. Add the bouillon cube, garam masala, turmeric, and cayenne, and cook while stirring for 30 - 60 seconds longer.","5. Add the potatoes and water. Cook until tender, about 15 minutes.","6. Then add the peas, chickpeas, and coconut milk. Cook until warmed through.","7. Finally, add the spinach, and when wilted, remove from the heat. Serve while hot and garnish as desired. Enjoy!"]
891.title: Potato & Green Pea Curry

892.ingredients: [15.8 oz(450 g)firm tofu, pressed, cut into 1 cm cubes , ½cup(120 mL)unsweetened soy yogurt, 2 tsp(3 g)garam masala, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, 1 tsp(2 g)ground coriander, ½ tspground turmeric, 1 pinchsalt, ¼cup(32 g)raw cashews, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 5cloves garlic, minced , 1large onion, chopped , 1jalapeño, seeds removed, minced , 2 tsp(4 g)freshly grated ginger, 1½ Tbsp(8 g)garam masala, 1½ Tbsp(9 g)ground coriander, 1½ Tbsp(13 g)ground cumin, 1 tsp(6 g)salt, ¼ tspcayenne pepper, 1⅔cups(400 g)canned diced tomatoes, ¼cup(66 g)canned tomato paste, ½ Tbsp(7 mL)agave syrup, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, cooked rice, fresh cilantro, naan]
892.recipe: ["1. Soak the raw cashews in boiling water to soften. Set aside for 10 minutes. Preheat the oven to 400°F (205°C).","2. In a bowl, combine the tofu, yogurt, garam masala, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and salt.","3. Transfer the tofu onto a lined baking tray and bake for 15 - 20 minutes, stirring once or twice. Keep an eye on it to prevent burning.","4. To a large pot on medium-high heat, sauté the oil, garlic, onion, jalapeño, and ginger for 5 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pan.","5. Add in the garam masala, coriander, cumin, salt, and cayenne pepper and cook for 1 more minute, stirring throughout to toast the spices.","6. Then add the drained cashews, diced tomatoes, tomato paste, agave syrup, and coconut milk. Blend everything using an immersion blender or transfer to a standing blender to blend until smooth. Let simmer on low, and cover with a lid.","7. Once the tofu is golden, remove it from the oven and add it to the pot. Give it a gentle stir and serve. Enjoy!"]
892.title: Vegan Butter "Chicken" with Baked Tofu

893.ingredients: [⅓cup(80 mL)vegan mayonnaise, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)ketchup, 2 Tbsp(18 g)chopped pickles, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)sweet chili sauce, 1 tsp(5 mL)pickle juice (from the jar), ¼ tspground black pepper]
893.recipe: ["1. Combine all of the ingredients together in a small bowl. Enjoy it as a sauce on burgers!"]
893.title: Thousand Island Sauce

894.ingredients: [4medium sweet potatoes, peeled, 1 Tbsp(8 g)cornstarch (optional), 2 Tbsp(30 mL)vegetable oil, ½ tsponion powder, ½ tspgarlic powder, ½ tspcoarse sea salt, 1 pinchground black pepper, 2 tsp(10 mL)vegetable oil, 1medium onion, finely chopped, 3cloves garlic, minced, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, ½ tspdried oregano, ½ tspsalt, ¼ tspsmoked sweet paprika powder, ¼ tspchili powder, 2medium carrots, minced, 1½cups(258 g)cooked black beans, 1⅔cups(400 g)canned diced tomatoes, ½cup(120 mL)boiling water, ½vegetable bouillon cube, ½cup(65 g)raw cashews, ½cup(120 mL)water, 2 Tbsp(4 g)nutritional yeast flakes, 2 tsp(10 mL)fresh lemon juice, ¼ tspgarlic powder, ¼ tsponion powder, ¼ tspsalt, or more to taste, ⅛ tspsmoked sweet paprika powder, 1cup(180 g)cherry tomatoes, chopped into quarters, 1small red onion, minced, ½lime, juiced, avocado, sliced green onion, sriracha hot sauce]
894.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 430°F (220°C). Cut the sweet potatoes into ½ inch (1 cm) thick sticks. Try to cut the fries in similar thicknesses, so they will cook evenly.","2. Divide the fries over two parchment parchment-lined baking trays*. Using your hands, coat the fries evenly with cornstarch.","3. Then add the oil, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper and toss to coat. Try to spread the fries as far apart from each other as possible. Bake for 20 minutes.","4. Flip the fries and switch the upper and lower baking tray. Continue to bake for another 20 - 25 minutes.","5. Prepare the chilli by heating a large pot on medium-high heat with oil. Add the onion and garlic, and cook until translucent for 3 - 5 minutes.","6. Then add the spices. Cook for another 1 minute, stirring throughout.","7. Add carrots, beans, tomatoes, water, and bouillon. Cook at a gentle simmer, partially covered, for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.","8. To make the cheese sauce, cover the cashews with boiling water and let them soak for 10 minutes, then drain.","9. Add the drained cashews, water, nutritional yeast, lemon juice, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and paprika to a high-speed blender. Blend until smooth.","10. Add the blended mixture to a saucepan over medium-high heat, stirring frequently. After about 3 minutes the sauce should have thickened a bit. Set aside.","11. To make the salsa, combine the cherry tomatoes, red onion, and lime juice in a small bowl.","12. Assemble the loaded chilli fries by placing the fries on a plate, topping them with the chilli, drizzle over the cheese sauce, salsa, and any other garnishes desired. Enjoy!"]
894.title: Loaded Chili Sweet Potato Fries

895.ingredients: [1avocado, peeled, pitted , 2cloves garlic, ¼cup(60 mL)unsweetened soy yogurt†, ½lime, juiced , ¼ tspsalt, 1 pinchground black pepper]
895.recipe: ["1. Add all ingredients to a small food processor and blend until creamy*. Mix, and enjoy!"]
895.title: Creamy Avocado Dip

896.ingredients: [3medium sweet potatoes, peeled, 2 tsp(5 g)cornstarch, 2 tsp(10 mL)vegetable oil, 1 tsp(2 g)onion powder, 1 tsp(1 g)dried oregano, ½ tsppaprika powder, ½ tspsalt, avocado dip, cinnamon mustard dip]
896.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 430°F (220°C). Cut the sweet potatoes into ½ inch (1 cm) thick fries. Try to cut the fries in similar thicknesses so they cook evenly.","2. Optional step: soak in cold water for about 5 minutes to remove the starch. Drain, then dry well using a clean kitchen cloth.","3. Transfer to a parchment-lined baking tray. Cover with starch and massage into the sweet potatoes using your hands. Then drizzle with oil, onion powder, oregano, paprika powder, and salt and toss to coat.","4. Divide over two baking trays, leaving as much room between the fries as possible. If over-crowded on the tray, they steam rather than roast.","5. Bake for 20 minutes, stir, then bake for another 8 - 10 minutes, or until golden. Serve with your favourite dip, and enjoy!"]
896.title: Oven-Roasted Sweet Potato Fries

897.ingredients: [1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 2medium onions, finely chopped, 4cloves garlic, minced, 1 Tbsp(6 g)fresh ginger, minced, 1red hot chili, minced, 1 Tbsp(6 g)curry powder, 2 tsp(6 g)ground turmeric, 1 tsp(2 g)garam masala, ½ tspsalt, 2cups(480 mL)boiling water, 1½cups(270 g)dry chana dal, soaked overnight†, 1vegetable bouillon cube, 1½cups(285 g)uncooked brown rice, soaked overnight, 2cups(480 mL)water, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, 1yellow bell pepper, chopped, 1red bell pepper, chopped, 1cup(180 g)cherry tomatoes, halved, chili flakes, fresh cilantro, lemon slices]
897.recipe: ["1. Add oil to a large pot on high heat. When hot, add the onion and cook until lightly golden, about 5 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pot.","2. Then add the garlic, ginger, and chili pepper and sauté for 2 - 3 minutes more.","3. Drop the heat to medium, and add the curry powder, turmeric, garam masala, and salt, and stir continuously for 30 seconds to toast the spices.","4. Add the boiling water, drained chana dal, and bouillon. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and partially cover. Cook for 30 - 40 minutes, or until the dal is cooked through*, stirring periodically to avoid burning. Add a splash of water as needed.","5. Meanwhile, add the drained rice and water to a medium pot. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, partially cover with a lid, and cook for 20 minutes. Then remove from the heat and leave covered.","6. Taste test the dal. When fully cooked through, add the coconut milk and bell peppers, and cook uncovered for 10 more minutes.","7. Then add the cherry tomatoes and cook for another 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Serve the dal with the rice, and garnish as desired. Enjoy!"]
897.title: Creamy Coconut Chana Dal

898.ingredients: [2cups(244 g)dry whole wheat macaroni, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 1medium onion, diced, 2cloves garlic, minced, 1⅔cups(400 g)canned diced tomatoes, 2 Tbsp(33 g)canned tomato paste, 1vegetable bouillon cube, crumbled , 1 tsp(3 g)chili powder, 1 tsp(2 g)paprika powder, 1 tsp(6 g)salt, ½ tspground black pepper, 1¾cups(310 g)cooked red kidney beans, 1½cups(170 g)soy veggie ground, 2medium carrots, diced, 1red bell pepper, 3cups(90 g)fresh spinach, roughly chopped]
898.recipe: ["1. Cook the macaroni according to the package directions, but decrease cooking time by 1 - 2 minutes. Once nearly al dente, drain.","2. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large pot on medium-high heat and cook the onions and garlic for 3 - 5 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pan.","3. Add the diced tomatoes, and rinse out the can with water (about 400 mL) adding this to the pot as well, along with the tomato paste, bouillon cube, and spices. Bring to a boil.","4. Once bubbling, add the kidney beans, veggie ground, carrot, and bell pepper. Cook until the carrots are soft, about 5 minutes.","5. Lastly, add the drained noodles and spinach. Cook for another minute, or until the pasta is al dente. Enjoy!"]
898.title: Macaroni Chili

899.ingredients: [¼cup(60 mL)sodium-reduced soy sauce, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)maple syrup, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)sriracha hot sauce, 8.8 oz(250 g)tempeh, 2medium potatoes, 1small onion, 1medium carrot, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)olive oil, 1 Tbsp(9 g)all-purpose flour, 1 tsp(3 g)garlic powder, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, ½ tspsalt, ½ tspground black pepper, 1 tsp(5 mL)vegetable oil, 2cups(298 g)cherry tomatoes, 3cloves garlic, crushed, 5cups(150 g)fresh spinach, 1avocado, sliced (optional), flaked sea salt, sriracha hot sauce]
899.recipe: ["1. In a large, shallow dish, mix together the soy sauce, maple syrup, and sriracha.","2. Slice the tempeh into 2 mm thin slices. Transfer to the shallow dish and toss to coat. Let marinate for at least 20 minutes. Mix once or twice while it's marinating to re-coat.","3. Meanwhile, using a box grater, shred the potatoes and place them into a large bowl filled with cold water. Let soak for 5 minutes to reduce the starchiness of the potatoes.","4. Preheat the oven to 390°F (200°C). Grate the onion and carrot into a large bowl. Add the oil, flour, garlic powder, cumin powder, salt, and pepper.","5. Drain the potatoes, place them on a clean dry cloth and squeeze to get rid of excess water. Add to the large bowl and mix.","6. Use a ½ cup measure to scoop the potato mixture into flat, ½ cm thick cakes on a parchment-lined baking tray.","7. On another lined tray, arrange the tempeh in a single layer and reserve any leftover marinade.","8. Bake both trays in the oven, on the middle and lower racks, for 10 minutes. Then flip both the potato cakes and tempeh slices. Use any leftover marinade to drizzle on the second side of the tempeh. Rotate the position of the trays in the oven and bake for another 10 - 15 minutes, or until golden and crispy.","9. Meanwhile, heat a medium pan on medium-high heat with oil. Add the cherry tomatoes and cook until the skins start to pop, about 2 minutes.","10. Then add the crushed garlic and cook until fragrant and golden, about 3 - 4 minutes. Remove from the pan and set aside.","11. To the now-empty pan, add the spinach. Stir often, and remove from the heat once fully wilted.","12. To serve, use a potato cake as the base, top with a few slices of baked tempeh, then the cooked spinach and blistered tomatoes. Top with avocado slices, and enjoy!"]
899.title: Potato Hash Cakes with Baked Marinated Tempeh

900.ingredients: [1 tsp(5 mL)olive oil, 1medium onion, diced, 4cloves garlic, minced, 1 Tbsp(6 g)fresh ginger, minced , 1 Tbsp(6 g)curry powder, 2 tsp(4 g)ground coriander, 2 tsp(5 g)paprika powder, ⅛ tspcayenne pepper, 4cups(960 mL)low-sodium vegetable stock†, 2medium sweet potatoes, cut into small cubes, 1medium banana, cut into coins†, 1medium carrot, chopped, ½cup(120 mL)peanut butter, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, coconut cream, fresh cilantro, roasted peanuts]
900.recipe: ["1. In a large pot over medium heat, add the oil, onions, garlic and ginger, cooking for about 3 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to prevent burning.","2. Add the spices, stirring to toast until fragrant, about 30 seconds.","3. Add the stock, sweet potatoes, banana, carrot, and peanut butter. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, cover with a lid, and cook until the sweet potatoes are cooked through, about 15 minutes.","4. Add the coconut milk, and blend using an immersion blender or standing blender. Heat through completely, and enjoy!"]
900.title: Peanut Butter Curry Soup

901.ingredients: [2 tsp(10 mL)olive oil, 6cloves garlic, ½medium butternut squash, peeled, chopped into 2 cm cubes, seeds reserved, 2red bell peppers, cut into quarters, 2medium carrots, sliced into 2 cm pieces, 1jalapeño, seeds removed, cut in half, 1medium onion, cut into wedges, ½ tspground cumin, ½ tsppaprika powder, ½ tspsalt, plus more to taste , ½ tspground black pepper, 3cups(720 mL)low-sodium vegetable stock†, ¾cup(180 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, 1 tsp(5 mL)olive oil, ¼ tspground cumin, ¼ tsppaprika powder, ¼ tspgarlic powder, ¼ tsponion powder, ¼ tspsalt, ¼ tspground black pepper, coconut cream]
901.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Toss all the roasted vegetable ingredients together on a lined baking tray.","2. Spread out evenly, and bake for 30 minutes or until the squash and carrots can be easily pierced with a fork. Toss the vegetables once or twice while they are baking.","3. Meanwhile, clean off the butternut squash seeds.","4. Toss the seeds with oil and spices, and bake on another lined baking tray for 15 minutes, until slightly golden. Stir once halfway. Remove from the oven and allow to cool.","5. After the veggies have roasted, add them straight to a large pot on high heat along with the vegetable stock and coconut milk.","6. Blend using a immersion blender. Alternatively, it can be added to a standing blender in batches, and blended until smooth. Heat through and garnish with the seasoned seeds. Enjoy!"]
901.title: Roasted Vegetable Harvest Soup

902.ingredients: [1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 2medium onions, diced, 3cloves garlic, crushed, 1red hot chili, minced , 1 tsp(3 g)ground turmeric, 1 tsp(2 g)curry powder, 1 tsp(2 g)garam masala, 1 tsp(6 g)salt, ½ tspground black pepper, 5cups(1200 mL)water, 2vegetable bouillon cubes, crushed , 3cups(576 g)dry brown lentils, soaked for at least 2 hours, drained†, 2medium potatoes, cut into 1 cm cubes, 2medium carrots, diced, ½medium broccoli, broken into bite-sized florets, fresh cilantro, fresh parsley, lemon slices]
902.recipe: ["1. Add the oil to a large pot on medium-high heat. Once hot, add the onions and cook for 5 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pot.","2. Add the garlic and red chilli, cook for another 2 minutes.","3. Add the spices and cook for 30 - 60 seconds, stirring throughout.","4. Add the water, bouillon*, lentils, and potatoes. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer, partially covered for 5 minutes.","5. Add the carrots and cook for another 10 minutes.","6. Add the broccoli and cook until tender, about 3 minutes. Optionally, blend half of the soup using an immersion blender to make it more creamy.","7. Adjust salt and pepper to your liking, and enjoy!"]
902.title: One-Pot Veggie Lentil Soup

903.ingredients: [2 Tbsp(14 g)ground flaxseeds, ¼cup(60 mL)water, 1 tsp(5 mL)vegetable oil, plus extra for frying, 2medium onions, diced, 2cloves garlic, minced, 2cups(140 g)button mushrooms, minced, ⅓cup(39 g)raw walnuts, minced, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)sodium-reduced soy sauce, ½ Tbsp(4 g)ground cumin, 1 tsp(2 g)ground coriander (optional), 1½cups(297 g)cooked brown lentils, 1cup(195 g)cooked brown rice, 1cup(108 g)breadcrumbs, 1 Tbsp(2 g)nutritional yeast flakes (optional), 1 Tbsp(15 mL)ketchup, 1 pinchground black pepper, 4burger buns, 1cup(20 g)arugula, 1avocado, sliced, 1medium tomato, sliced, pickled jalapeño slices, sriracha mayo]
903.recipe: ["1. Add the ground flaxseeds and water to a large bowl, mix, and set aside to gel.","2. Add the oil to a large pan on high heat. When hot, add the onions and garlic and sauté until lightly golden, about 5 minutes, adding a splash of water as needed to deglaze the pan.","3. Then add the mushroom and walnuts, and cook until most of the moisture has evaporated, which takes about 5 - 8 minutes.","4. Add the soy sauce, cumin, and coriander and continue to cook until all the moisture is evaporated. Remove the pan from the heat.","5. Add the lentils to the same bowl as the flaxseeds and mash as best you can using an immersion blender, potato masher, or fork.","6. To the lentils, add the cooked mushroom mixture, rice, breadcrumbs, nutritional yeast, ketchup, and pepper. Using your hands, mix well and then form into burger patties.","7. In a large pan on medium heat, add a bit of vegetable oil and cook the patties until golden on each side, about 2 - 3 minutes per side.","8. When the patties are ready, assemble your burger, and enjoy!"]
903.title: Mushroom & Rice Burger

904.ingredients: [1 tsp(5 mL)vegetable oil, 3cloves garlic, crushed, 1cup(113 g)soy veggie ground, 2 Tbsp(17 g)Mexican spice mix, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)water, 2medium (20 cm) ready-made pizza crusts, 1 tsp(5 mL)olive oil, 5 Tbsp(82 g)canned tomato paste, 1bell pepper, diced , 1small red onion, thinly sliced , ⅓cup(55 g)canned corn, ¼cup(38 g)pickled jalapeño slices, 10cherry tomatoes, cut in half , 1avocado, sliced, 1stalk green onion, sliced, ¼cup(60 mL)unsweetened soy yogurt, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)vegan mayonnaise, 2 Tbsp(2 g)fresh cilantro, ¼ tspsalt, fresh cilantro, homemade pizza dough]
904.recipe: ["1. Add the oil to a small pan on high heat. When hot, add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes.","2. Then add the veggie ground, spice mix, and water. Cook for another 2 minutes.","3. Preheat the oven to 390°F (200°C). Lightly brush the top of the pizza crusts with some olive oil, then spread over the tomato paste.","4. Divide the veggie ground mixture over the pizzas, and top with the bell pepper, onion, corn, jalapeños, and cherry tomatoes.","5. Bake in the centre rack of the oven for 12 - 15 minutes, or until the crust is lightly golden.","6. Meanwhile, make cilantro sauce by mixing the ingredients in a small bowl.","7. When the pizza is done, top it with dollops of the yogurt sauce, some sliced avocado, and sliced green onions. Enjoy!"]
904.title: Mexican Pizza

905.ingredients: [3nectarines, chopped, 1medium tomato, chopped, 1red bell pepper, chopped , ½small red onion, minced, 1jalapeño, minced , 1lime, juiced , 2 Tbsp(2 g)fresh cilantro, coarsely ripped , 2 Tbsp(4 g)fresh mint leaves, thinly sliced , 1 pinchsalt, to taste, 1 pinchground black pepper, to taste, baked tortilla chips, tortilla chips]
905.recipe: ["1. Add all of the ingredients to a medium bowl. Stir to combine, and enjoy!"]
905.title: Nectarine Salsa

906.ingredients: [2 tsp(10 mL)vegetable oil, 1medium onion, finely chopped, 3cloves garlic, minced, 1 Tbsp(6 g)fresh ginger, minced , 2cups(328 g)cooked chickpeas, 2½cups(175 g)button mushrooms, thinly sliced, 1 Tbsp(6 g)curry powder, ½ tsppaprika powder, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, 1bell pepper, thinly sliced, 1 pinchsalt, 1 pinchground black pepper, 4cups(120 g)fresh spinach, 15cherry tomatoes, halved , cooked rice, lemon slices, naan]
906.recipe: ["1. Add the oil, onion, garlic, and ginger to a large pot on high heat and sauté for 3 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pot.","2. Add the chickpeas and mushrooms to the pot and cook for 5 minutes.","3. Add the curry and paprika powder and sauté for one minute longer.","4. Add the coconut milk, bell peppers, salt and pepper, and cook for another 5 minutes.","5. Add the spinach and tomatoes at the end, and stir. When the spinach has wilted, remove from heat.","6. Serve and garnish as desired. Enjoy!"]
906.title: Mushroom & Chickpea Coconut Curry

907.ingredients: [3 Tbsp(29 g)garlic powder, 3 Tbsp(25 g)ground cumin, 3 Tbsp(21 g)onion powder, 3 Tbsp(20 g)paprika powder, 2 Tbsp(16 g)chili powder, 1½ Tbsp(27 g)salt, 2 tsp(2 g)dried oregano (optional) , 1 tsp(2 g)ground black pepper]
907.recipe: ["1. Mix all the ingredients together in a jar. Seal until ready to use."]
907.title: Homemade Mexican Seasoning

908.ingredients: [2avocados, ½lime, juiced, 1clove garlic, crushed, 2 Tbsp(20 g)minced red onion, ½ tspground cumin, ¼ tsppaprika powder, ¼ tspsalt, 1 pinchcayenne pepper, 5cherry tomatoes, chopped (optional), baked tortilla chips, fresh cilantro]
908.recipe: ["1. Mash the avocado in a bowl, then add the remaining ingredients and stir to combine.","2. Serve on salad bowls, tacos, burritos, or enjoy with tortilla chips as a dip!"]
908.title: Quick Guacamole

909.ingredients: [1 tsp(3 g)garlic powder, 1 tsp(2 g)onion powder, 1 tsp(2 g)paprika powder, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, ½ tspchili powder, ¼ tspsalt, ⅛ tspground black pepper, 1½cups(297 g)cooked brown lentils, ½cup(58 g)raw walnuts, chopped, ¼cup(36 g)roasted sunflower seeds, chopped, 1 tsp(5 mL)olive oil, 4cups(140 g)romaine lettuce, chopped, 1medium tomato, seeds removed, diced, 1bell pepper, diced, ½cucumber, diced, ½cup(82 g)canned corn, drained, ¼cup(34 g)sliced black olives, ½cup(65 g)raw cashews, ⅓cup(80 mL)boiling water, 1lime, juiced, 1avocado, chopped, 1lime, juiced , 3cloves garlic, crushed, ½small red onion, diced, baked tortilla chips, fresh cilantro, salsa, sriracha hot sauce]
909.recipe: ["1. In a small jar, combine all the spices for the spice mix.","2. In a medium bowl, combine the lentils, walnuts, sunflower seeds, olive oil, and the spice mix. Set aside.","3. In a large salad bowl, add the lettuce, tomatoes, bell pepper, cucumber, corn, and olives. Set aside.","4. Add all the cashew lime cream ingredients to a small food processor or blender and blend until smooth. Add more water if you prefer a thinner consistency.","5. To make the guacamole, mash the avocado in a bowl with a fork, then stir in the remaining ingredients. Set aside.","6. To assemble, add the salad base to the bottom of your bowl. Top it with scoops of the lentil-walnut mixture, then add any desired toppings like guacamole, sriracha, salsa, cashew lime cream, or fresh cilantro. Lastly, add a crunch from crushed tortilla chips if desired. Enjoy!"]
909.title: Lentil Taco Salad

910.ingredients: [2medium sweet potatoes, cut into 2 cm cubes, 1 tsp(5 mL)vegetable oil, ¼cup(34 g)frozen green peas, ½ tspground cumin, ½ tspground coriander (optional) , ½ tspground turmeric, ½ tspdried fenugreek leaves (optional), 1 pinchsalt, 1 pinchground black pepper, 1 tsp(5 mL)vegetable oil, 1medium onion, diced, 11.4 oz(325 g)firm tofu, drained, 1 tsp(3 g)ground turmeric, 1 tsp(1 g)nutritional yeast flakes, 1 tsp(3 g)garlic powder, 1 pinchsalt, plus more to taste, 1 pinchground black pepper, plus more to taste, 3large (25 cm) soft tortillas, 1avocado, sliced, 1bell pepper, sliced, 2 tsp(10 mL)hot sauce(optional)]
910.recipe: ["1. For the samosa potatoes, use a steamer basket to steam the potatoes in a medium pot over high heat for 10 - 15 minutes, or until easily pierced with a fork.","2. For the tofu scramble, heat the oil in a medium pan over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until soft.","3. Gently squeeze out any excess water from the tofu, then crumble the tofu into the frying pan using your hands.","4. Add the turmeric, nutritional yeast, garlic powder, salt, and pepper to the tofu. Cook for 3 - 5 minutes, or until everything is heated through. Transfer to a plate.","5. Back to the samosa potatoes, return the now-empty tofu pan to the stove and melt the coconut oil, then add in the soft potatoes. Panfry and mash the potatoes for 1 - 2 minutes.","6. Then add the peas, cumin, coriander, turmeric, fenugreek, salt, and pepper. Cook for 2 minutes, then transfer to a plate.","7. To assemble the wraps, add some potato filling and tofu scramble to the wrap, and top with avocado, and sliced peppers. Enjoy right away or place in an airtight container and take for breakfast the next day. Enjoy!"]
910.title: Samosa Sweet Potato Breakfast Wraps with Tofu Scramble

911.ingredients: [1 tsp(5 mL)vegetable oil, 1medium onion, diced, 2cloves garlic, crushed, 2 Tbsp(50 g)vegan Thai green curry paste, 1medium sweet potato, cut into 1 cm cubes, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, 1¼cups(205 g)cooked chickpeas, ½cup(120 mL)water†, 2cups(60 g)fresh spinach, cooked rice, naan]
911.recipe: ["1. To a large pot on high heat, add the oil and onions, and cook until the onions are soft, about 3 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pot.","2. Add the garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute.","3. Add the curry paste, and mash into the garlic and onion mixture until fragrant, about 30 seconds.","4. Then add the sweet potato, coconut milk, chickpeas, and water*.","5. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer for 10 - 15 minutes, partially covered, until the sweet potatoes are cooked through.","6. Remove from heat and add the spinach, stirring to wilt.","7. Serve over rice or with naan, and enjoy!"]
911.title: Thai Sweet Potato & Chickpea Green Curry

912.ingredients: [1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 2medium shallots, minced, 3cloves garlic, minced , 10.5 oz(300 g)tempeh, 2 tsp(5 g)onion powder, 1 tsp(2 g)paprika powder, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, ½ tspchili powder, ½ tspdried oregano, ⅛ tspground black pepper, 1⅔cups(400 g)canned diced tomatoes, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)sodium-reduced soy sauce, 9small (10 cm) corn tortillas, 18cherry tomatoes, chopped, 1avocado, sliced, 2 Tbsp(20 g)minced red onion, ½cup(65 g)raw cashews, ⅓cup(80 mL)boiling water, 1lime, juiced, fresh cilantro, lime slices]
912.recipe: ["1. To a large pan on high heat, add the oil, shallots, and garlic and sauté for 2 minutes.","2. Crumble the tempeh into the pan with your hands and cook for 6 - 7 minutes, stirring until lightly golden. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pan.","3. Meanwhile, make the cashew cream by adding the ingredients to a small food processor. Blend until smooth. Add more water if needed to achieve your desired consistency.","4. Returning to the pan with the tempeh, add the spices and cook for 30 seconds. Then add the diced tomato and soy sauce, cooking for a final 3 - 5 minutes.","5. Meanwhile, heat the tortillas on a skillet. Spoon the tempeh it onto the warmed tortillas, top with tomatoes, avocado slices, and onions. Enjoy!"]
912.title: Tempeh Tacos with Cashew Lime Cream

913.ingredients: [1head cauliflower, cut into bite-sized pieces, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 1 tsp(3 g)garlic powder, 1 tsp(2 g)onion powder, ½ tsppaprika powder, ¼ tspsalt, ¼ tspground black pepper, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 1medium onion, diced, 3cloves garlic, crushed, 1 Tbsp(6 g)curry powder, ½ Tbsp(2 g)garam masala, ½ Tbsp(5 g)ground turmeric, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, 1 tsp(2 g)ground coriander, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cinnamon, 1 tsp(6 g)salt, 1⅔cups(400 g)canned diced tomatoes, 10cherry tomatoes, halved (optional) , 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, 1¼cups(248 g)cooked brown lentils, 2cups(60 g)fresh spinach, cooked brown rice, naan]
913.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 410°F (210°C). Toss the cauliflower with the oil and spices. Spread on a parchment-lined baking tray. Roast on the centre rack of the oven for 40 - 45 minutes, mixing once halfway.","2. Add the oil to a large pot on medium-high heat. When hot, add the onion and cook until lightly golden. Add splashes of water if needed to deglaze the pot.","3. Then add the garlic and all of the spices, and stir continuously to toast for 30 - 60 seconds.","4. Then add the can of tomatoes and sliced tomatoes. Allow to simmer for 5 minutes.","5. Finally, add the coconut milk, lentils, spinach, and roasted cauliflower, and mix until everything is heated through, about 5 minutes.","6. Serve and enjoy!"]
913.title: Roasted Cauliflower Lentil Curry

914.ingredients: [1 tsp(5 mL)vegetable oil, 2medium onions, diced, 2cloves garlic, crushed, 2vegetable bouillon cubes, 1medium zucchini, chopped, 3red bell peppers, chopped (also known as paprikas), 1 tsp(2 g)ground coriander, ¼cup(38 g)sun-dried bell pepper in oil, drained, 2cups(480 mL)water, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, croutons]
914.recipe: ["1. Heat the oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the onions and sauté until golden, about 5 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pot.","2. Add the garlic and bouillon cubes and stir until the cubes have dissolved and the garlic is fragrant, about 1 - 2 minutes.","3. Add the zucchini, bell peppers, coriander, and sun-dried paprika to the pot, and sauté for 4 - 5 minutes.","4. Add the water, and bring everything to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and partially cover with a lid. Cook for 10 - 15 minutes.","5. Add the coconut milk, let it heat through, then purée the soup with an immersion blender or standing blender until creamy. Serve, garnish, and enjoy!"]
914.title: Creamy Coconut Paprika Zucchini Soup

915.ingredients: [1 tsp(5 mL)vegetable oil, 1medium onion, chopped, 3cloves garlic, minced, 1medium carrot, finely chopped, 1 Tbsp(6 g)freshly grated ginger, 2 tsp(4 g)curry powder, 1 tsp(3 g)ground turmeric, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, ½ tsppaprika powder, 1 pinchsalt, to taste, 2cups(384 g)dry red lentils, rinsed, soaked for 2 hours, 2cups(480 mL)water, 1vegetable bouillon cube, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, 1½cups(300 g)uncooked basmati rice, rinsed, soaked for 2 hours†, 2¼cups(540 mL)water, 6cardamom pods, cracked, fresh cilantro, unsweetened coconut yogurt]
915.recipe: ["1. Add the oil, onion, and garlic to a sauté pan on medium-high heat. Cook for 4 minutes, adding splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pot.","2. Add the carrot and ginger, and cook for another 2 minutes.","3. Then add all of the spices. Stir for 30 - 60 seconds to toast the spices.","4. Drain the lentils and add them to the pan with the water and bouillon. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, cover, and cook for 15 minutes.","5. Meanwhile, drain the soaked rice and add it to a medium pot. Add the water and the cardamom pods, cover, and cook at a gentle simmer for 13 minutes, or until cooked. Then remove from the heat and fully cover with a lid until ready to serve.","6. Add the coconut milk and cook until heated through.","7. Serve the rice alongside the daal. Garnish as desired. Enjoy!"]
915.title: Comforting Coconut Red Lentil Daal

916.ingredients: [1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 1small onion, chopped, 4cloves garlic, minced, ½ tspsalt, 10button mushrooms, finely chopped (optional), 21.1 oz(600 g)firm tofu, pressed, 1 Tbsp(3 g)dried oregano, 1 Tbsp(7 g)paprika powder, 1 tsp(3 g)chili powder (optional), ½ tspground coriander (optional), ½ tspground cumin, ½ tspground black pepper, ⅛ tspground cinnamon, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)apple cider vinegar, 1 tsp(5 mL)sodium-reduced soy sauce]
916.recipe: ["1. Add the oil to a large pan on high heat. When hot, add the onion, garlic, and salt, and cook for about 3 minutes.","2. Then add the mushrooms and continue to cook until the mushrooms release their moisture and begin to brown, about 7 minutes.","3. Reduce the heat to medium-high. Crumble the tofu with your hands into the pan. Cook, stirring and scraping the bottom of the pan to avoid burning, until the tofu browns and crisps to your liking, between 15 - 30 minutes.","4. Add in the spices and continue to cook and scrape until fragrant, about 1 - 2 minutes.","5. Add the vinegar and soy sauce, and stir to combine. Enjoy!"]
916.title: Vegan Tofu Chorizo

917.ingredients: [1½cups(285 g)uncooked brown rice, soaked overnight, drained†, 2¼cups(540 mL)water, 1vegetable bouillon cube, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)olive oil, 2medium onions, chopped, 2cloves garlic, minced, 10button mushrooms, sliced, ¼cup(35 g)Mexican spice mix, 1red bell pepper, thinly sliced, 2cups(60 g)fresh spinach, chopped , 1⅔cups(400 g)canned diced tomatoes, 1½cups(170 g)soy veggie ground, 1cup(165 g)canned corn, ⅓cup(57 g)cooked black beans(optional), 1avocado, 1clove garlic, crushed , 2 tsp(10 mL)sriracha hot sauce, ½lime, juiced, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)chipotle adobo sauce, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)unsweetened soy yogurt, chili flakes, fresh chives ]
917.recipe: ["1. In a medium pot, bring the rice, water, and bouillon to a boil. Then reduce to a simmer, partially cover, and cook for 20 minutes*. When cooked, remove from the heat, fully cover, and let rest for a few minutes.","2. Meanwhile, in a large pan on high heat, add the oil and sauté the onions and garlic until lightly golden, about 5 minutes.","3. Add the mushrooms and spice mix. Cook until the water released from the mushrooms evaporates, about 8 minutes.","4. Then add the bell pepper, spinach, tomatoes, veggie ground, corn, and beans and cook for 7 more minutes.","5. Meanwhile, mash the avocado, and mix the guacamole ingredients in a bowl.","6. For the chipotle yogurt sauce, mix the ingredients in a small bowl.","7. To serve, add the rice to a bowl, the mushroom mixture, guacamole, and yogurt sauce. Garnish and enjoy!"]
917.title: Burrito Nourish Bowl with Creamy Guacamole

918.ingredients: [2 tsp(10 mL)olive oil, 1medium onion, diced , 2cloves garlic, crushed , 1 tsp(2 g)curry powder, 1 tsp(2 g)paprika powder, ½ tspground coriander, ½ tspgaram masala, ¼ tspground turmeric, 3medium potatoes, cut into 1 cm cubes, 1medium zucchini, finely chopped, 1medium carrot, finely chopped, 1cup(192 g)dry red lentils, soaked in hot water for 10 minutes , 2vegetable bouillon cubes, 4cups(960 mL)water, ½lemon, juiced, chili flakes, fresh cilantro, unsweetened soy yogurt]
918.recipe: ["1. Add the oil to a large pot on high heat. When hot, add the onion and sauté until golden, about 5 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pan.","2. Then add garlic and the spices, and cook for another 2 minutes.","3. Add the potatoes, zucchini, carrots, drained lentils, bouillon cubes, and water. Bring to boil, reduce to a simmer, and partially cover. Cook for 15 minutes, or until the lentils and potatoes are cooked.","4. Optionally, for a creamier texture, use an immersion blender to purée some of the soup. Then add the lemon juice.","5. Garnish as desired, serve hot and enjoy!"]
918.title: Curry Lentil Soup

919.ingredients: [4medium sweet potatoes, 1 tsp(5 mL)olive oil, 2stalks green onion, chopped (optional), 1medium onion, chopped, 2cloves garlic, crushed, 1 tsp(2 g)curry powder, ½ tspground cumin, ½ tspground coriander, ½cup(96 g)dry red lentils, rinsed, ½cup(85 g)uncooked quinoa, rinsed, 2cups(480 mL)water, ½vegetable bouillon cube, 1 tsp(5 mL)sambal oelek (optional), ½medium broccoli, cut into bite-sized florets, 1red bell pepper, chopped, ¼cup(60 mL)tahini, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)water, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)balsamic vinegar, 2 tsp(10 mL)sodium-reduced soy sauce]
919.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (210°C). Pierce the sweet potatoes with a fork in several locations and place on a lined baking tray. Roast on the middle rack of the oven until tender, about 45 minutes, stopping once to flip.","2. Add the oil to a large pot on high heat. When hot, add the onions, cooking for 5 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to de-glaze the pan.","3. Add the garlic and cook for another 2 minutes, stirring often.","4. Then add the curry powder, cumin, and coriander, stirring continuously for 30 - 60 seconds to toast the spices.","5. Then add the lentils, quinoa, water, bouillon cube, and sambal. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer, cooking for 10 minutes with the lid partially covered.","6. Then add the broccoli and bell pepper. Stir, cover fully with the lid, and cook for 5 minutes.","7. Meanwhile, mix all of the dressing ingredients in a small bowl.","8. When the cooked sweet potatoes are cool enough to handle, slice them lengthwise and gently squeeze open. Use a fork to mash the inside to make room for the fillings on top.","9. Scoop the lentil and quinoa mixture into the \"pockets\" of the sweet potato. Drizzle the sauce generously over top, and enjoy!"]
919.title: Quinoa & Red Lentil Stuffed Sweet Potatoes

920.ingredients: [2avocados, 2cloves garlic, 2 tsp(10 mL)sriracha hot sauce, ¼ tsponion powder (optional), 1lime, juiced, 1 pinchsalt (optional)]
920.recipe: ["1. Add all the ingredients to a small food processor* and blend until creamy. Enjoy with nourish bowls, in wraps, in sandwiches, or as a dip!"]
920.title: Avocado Garlic Cream

921.ingredients: [6large bell peppers, 1 tsp(5 mL)vegetable oil, 1medium onion, chopped, 3cloves garlic, crushed , 1½cups(170 g)soy veggie ground, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, 1 tsp(1 g)Italian spice mix, ½ tspground turmeric, ⅛ tspsalt , plus extra for sprinkling, 1 pinchground black pepper, ¾cup(198 g)tomato based pasta sauce, 1½cups(303 g)cooked mung beans, 1½cups(292 g)cooked brown rice, ½cup(68 g)green olives, avocado, fresh cilantro, hot sauce, minced red onion]
921.recipe: ["1. Cut the bell peppers in half lengthwise and discard the seeds. Sprinkle the insides of the bell peppers lightly with salt.","2. In a large pan on high heat, add the oil and onions and sauté for 5 minutes, adding splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pan.","3. Then add the garlic and sauté for another 2 minutes.","4. Then add the soy ground and spices and cook for 2 - 3 minutes.","5. Finally, stir in the pasta sauce, beans, cooked brown rice, and olives.","6. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Stuff the peppers with the rice mixture on a parchment-lined baking tray. Bake covered on the middle rack of the oven for 30 - 40 minutes, or until the bell peppers are lightly charred and cooked to your liking.","7. Serve with a garnish of your choice and enjoy!"]
921.title: Protein-Packed Vegan Stuffed Bell Peppers

922.ingredients: [2 tsp(10 mL)vegetable oil, 1medium onion, sliced, 2cloves garlic, crushed, 5cups(350 g)button mushrooms, coarsely chopped, 1½ tsp(5 g)Cajun seasoning, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, 1 tsp(2 g)paprika powder, ¼ tspcayenne pepper (optional), ¼ tspsalt, ¼ tspground black pepper, 2cups(396 g)cooked brown lentils, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)chipotle adobo sauce†, 1avocado, 1lime, juiced , 2cloves garlic, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)unsweetened soy milk, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, ¼ tspsalt, 8small (15 cm) soft tortillas, 1cup(70 g)shredded red cabbage, 1cup(180 g)cherry tomatoes, quartered, 4small raw radishes, sliced (optional) , fresh cilantro, lime slices]
922.recipe: ["1. To a large pan on medium-high heat, add the oil and onion. Sauté until the onions turn golden, about 4 minutes.","2. Add the garlic and sauté for another 2 minutes.","3. Add the mushrooms and all the spices to the pan and cook for about 8 minutes. Add a small splash of water if needed to prevent the spices from burning, but note the mushrooms will also start to release their own liquid after a minute.","4. Add the lentils and chipotle sauce, stir and cook until everything is heated through.","5. Prepare the avocado cream by adding all the ingredients to a small food processor and blending on high until smooth. Alternatively, mash the ingredients in a bowl for a chunkier sauce.","6. Serve the mushroom lentil filling on the wraps and top with cabbage, juicy tomatoes, and crisp radish. Dollop on the avocado cream and serve with lime wedges. Enjoy!"]
922.title: Mushroom & Lentil Tacos with Garlic Avocado Cream

923.ingredients: [1 tsp(5 mL)olive oil, 2medium onions, chopped, 2cloves garlic, crushed, 2medium raw beets, peeled, cut into 1 cm cubes, 3medium sweet potatoes, peeled, cut into 1 cm cubes, 1vegetable bouillon cube, 2cups(480 mL)water, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, ½ tsppaprika powder, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned full-fat coconut milk, croutons]
923.recipe: ["1. To a large pot on high heat, add the oil and onions, stirring occasionally for 5 - 7 minutes, until the onions caramelize. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pan.","2. Add the garlic and stir until golden, about 2 minutes.","3. Then add the beets, sweet potatoes, bouillon, water, cumin, and paprika. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, partially cover, and cook for 15 minutes.","4. Once the potatoes and beetroots are soft, purée using an immersion blender or standing blender.","5. Then add the coconut milk. Once heated through, remove from the heat. Serve while hot and enjoy!"]
923.title: Creamy Beetroot & Sweet Potato Soup

924.ingredients: [3avocados, 1lime, juiced , 2cloves garlic, crushed, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, ½ tspchili powder, ½ tspsalt, ½small red onion, minced , 2medium tomatoes, chopped, 2 Tbsp(6 g)chopped fresh chives (optional), baked tortilla chips]
924.recipe: ["1. To a large bowl, add the avocados, lime juice, garlic, and spices. Mash the avocados, leaving some chunks if a textured consistency is preferred.","2. Gently stir in the onion, tomato*, and chives. Garnish and serve with tortilla chips or fresh veggies, or enjoy in sandwiches or wraps!"]
924.title: Easy Chunky Guacamole

925.ingredients: [1½cups(246 g)cooked chickpeas, ¼cup(36 g)roasted sunflower seeds, 1small onion, 2cloves garlic, ½lemon, juiced, ½cup(8 g)fresh dill, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, ½ tspground coriander, ¼ tspsalt, ¼ tspcayenne pepper]
925.recipe: ["1. Preheat oven to 400°F (210°C). Blend the ingredients in a food processor until well combined. With your hands, press into little patties.","2. Place on a parchment-lined baking tray and bake in the centre rack of the oven until golden, about 35 minutes. At the halfway point, flip the patties to ensure even cooking on both sides. Remove from the oven, and enjoy!"]
925.title: Baked Dill Falafels

926.ingredients: [4slices whole wheat bread, ½cup(123 g)hummus, 1avocado, sliced , 1cup(25 g)fresh spinach, ¼cucumber, sliced, 1medium tomato, sliced, -5green olive, halved , ½small red onion, thinly sliced (optional), ¼medium carrot, shredded (optional), 1 Tbsp(15 mL)sweet chili sauce (optional)]
926.recipe: ["1. Divide the ingredients between the breads to make sandwiches. That’s it - enjoy!"]
926.title: Loaded Avocado & Hummus Veggie Sandwich

927.ingredients: [2 Tbsp(14 g)ground flaxseeds, 6 Tbsp(90 mL)water, 1medium onion, diced , 1 tsp(5 mL)olive oil, 2cloves garlic, crushed, 1½cups(256 g)cooked pinto beans, ⅓cup(41 g)raw sunflower seeds, ¾cup(61 g)rolled oats, ½ Tbsp(4 g)ground cumin, ½ Tbsp(3 g)paprika powder, 2 tsp(7 g)Cajun seasoning, 4cups(280 g)button mushrooms, thinly sliced, 1 tsp(5 mL)olive oil, 2red bell peppers, thinly sliced, ½ tsponion powder, ½ tspgarlic powder, ½ tsppaprika powder, ½ tspground cumin, ⅓cup(43 g)raw cashews, soaked in boiling water for 10 minutes, 1lime, juiced , 2 tsp(7 g)Cajun seasoning, 6whole-wheat buns, 1cup(219 g)coleslaw (optional) , 1cup(20 g)arugula, ¼cup(38 g)pickled jalapeño slices (optional)]
927.recipe: ["1. In a small bowl, mix together the ground flax seeds and water. Set aside.","2. To a large pan on high heat, sauté the onions in oil until lightly golden, about 5 minutes. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pan.","3. Then add the garlic and sauté for another 2 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a food processor, and return the empty pan to the stove.","4. To the pan, sauté the mushrooms in oil on medium-high heat for 5 minutes.","5. Meanwhile, return to the food processor. Add in the flaxseed mixture, beans, sunflower seeds, oats, cumin, paprika, and Cajun seasoning. Blend on high until well combined. Set aside.","6. Returning to the pan with the mushrooms, add the bell peppers, onion powder, and garlic powder and cook for another 3 minutes. Set aside.","7. Prepare the cajun 'mayo' by placing the cashews, lime juice, and Cajun seasoning in a small food processor. Blend on high until creamy.","8. Divide the bean and oat mixture into the desired number of patties. Shape the mixture into patty shapes using your hands.","9. Add some oil to a non-stick pan on medium-high heat, and cook the patties for 3 - 4 minutes per side, or until lightly golden.","10. Serve on burger buns with coleslaw, the sautéed mushroom and bell pepper mix, and topped with Cajun mayo, arugula, and jalapeños. Enjoy!"]
927.title: Bean & Oat Burger with Cajun Mayo

928.ingredients: [8cups(560 g)shredded red cabbage, 2medium raw beets, peeled, grated, 1½ Tbsp(22 g)coarse sea salt (iodine free)†, 1 Tbsp(5 g)whole coriander seeds]
928.recipe: ["1. To a large bowl, add the cabbage, beetroot, and salt.","2. Work the salt into the vegetables by firmly massaging with your clean hands*. Continue to massage and squeeze for 10 - 15 minutes. The cabbage will soften as you continue to massage, and liquids will naturally release to create a brine.","3. When finished massaging, mix in the coriander seeds. Transfer the mixture, including the brine, into a clean glass jar. Do not fill the jar beyond ¾ full as the sauerkraut needs some \"breathing\" room.","4. Firmly push down the mixture until the vegetables are fully submerged under the brine. If not fully submerged, mix ½ teaspoon of salt in 1 cup (240 mL) of water and add this to the jar.","5. Place a clean weight on top of the vegetables to keep them fully submerged under the brine throughout the fermentation process. For our weight, we used a small glass jar filled with rice (see photo).","6. Close with an air-tight lid and allow the sauerkraut to ferment for 5 - 10 days away from direct sunlight and at a moderate temperature, about 18 - 24°C (65 - 75°F).","7. Every day, pop open the lid of the jar to allow the gas to escape*. If needed, press down the weight on top of the sauerkraut to ensure all the veggies remain submerged.","8. Taste test after 4 days to determine when you’d like to stop fermentation.","9. Once fermented, seal the jar airtight with a lid and place it in the fridge until ready to enjoy."]
928.title: Beetroot & Red Cabbage Sauerkraut

929.ingredients: [1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 1medium onion, diced, 1medium potato, cut into 1 cm cubes, 1cup(192 g)dry green lentils, preferably soaked overnight†, 1cup(240 mL)water, ½ tspground turmeric, ½ tspground cinnamon, ½ tspsalt, plus more to taste ]
929.recipe: ["1. Add the oil and onions to a medium pot on medium-high heat and sauté until the onions are lightly golden, about 3 - 5 minutes.","2. Add the remaining ingredients. Partially cover, bring to a boil, and reduce heat to a simmer*. Stir once or twice until the lentils are soft and the potatoes cooked, which takes approximately 20 minutes. If the lentils were not pre-soaked, more water may be needed. Serve, and enjoy!"]
929.title: Warm Lentil & Potato Salad

930.ingredients: [1avocado, chopped, 1mango, chopped, 2medium tomatoes, chopped , ¼cup(4 g)fresh cilantro, chopped, ½small onion, minced , ½lime, juiced , baked tortilla chips, tortilla chips]
930.recipe: ["1. Chop the avocado, mango, tomatoes, and cilantro. Mince the onion.","2. Place all ingredients in a bowl, and squeeze over the lime juice.","3. Toss, serve, and enjoy!"]
930.title: Chunky Avocado Mango Salsa

931.ingredients: [3 Tbsp(45 mL)vegetable oil, 1large onion, chopped, 3 Tbsp(49 g)canned tomato paste, ½ tspground turmeric, 1head cauliflower, broken into bite-sized pieces, 1red hot chili, minced (optional), 1cup(240 mL)water, ¾ tspsalt, 1 pinchground black pepper, cooked rice]
931.recipe: ["1. Add the oil and onion to medium pot on high heat and stir until the onion has become golden.","2. Add the tomato paste and turmeric, and stir continuously for 30 seconds to lightly toast.","3. Then add the remaining ingredients, cover, bring to a boil, and reduce to a gentle simmer, stirring every 5 minutes until water has been absorbed. The dish is ready when the cauliflower is soft. Enjoy!"]
931.title: Gulpea: Afghan Tomato & Cauliflower Curry

932.ingredients: [2 tsp(10 mL)vegetable oil, 1large onion, chopped, 4cloves garlic, minced, 1 Tbsp(8 g)chili powder, 1 Tbsp(8 g)ground cumin, 2 tsp(2 g)dried oregano, 1 tsp(2 g)smoked sweet paprika powder, ¼ tspground black pepper, 3cups(720 mL)canned crushed tomatoes, chopped, 1½cups(258 g)cooked black beans, 1½cups(266 g)cooked red kidney beans, 1½cups(297 g)cooked brown lentils, 2vegetable bouillon cubes, crushed, 2 Tbsp(33 g)canned tomato paste, 2cups(480 mL)boiling water, 1medium carrot, finely chopped, 1red bell pepper, finely chopped, ¾cup(124 g)canned corn, 1avocado, chopped, ½lime, cut into wedges, ½cup(120 g)vegan sour cream, ¼cup(4 g)fresh cilantro (optional) ]
932.recipe: ["1. To a large pot on medium heat add the oil and onion and sauté for about 4 - 5 minutes, adding splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pan.","2. Then add the garlic and spices and cook while stirring for 1 - 2 minutes more.","3. Stir in the crushed tomatoes, beans, lentils, crushed vegetable bouillon cubes, tomato paste, water, carrots, and bell pepper.","4. Bring everything to a boil and then reduce to a simmer, cooking for 25 - 30 minutes. Stir in the corn in the last few minutes before serving.","5. Add your desired toppings, and enjoy!"]
932.title: Hearty Vegan Chili

933.ingredients: [1 medium yellow onion, cut into large chunks, 1 large red bell pepper, seeded and roughly chopped, 2 large cubanelle peppers, seeded and roughly chopped*, 10 garlic cloves, peeled and roughly chopped, 1 large bunch cilantro, stems and leaves, roughly chopped (about 1 1/2 packed cups), 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil, 1 bunch culantro, optional if you can find it]
933.recipe: ["1. Roughly chop all ingredients and combine in a large bowl.","2. Pulse in the blender or food processor in about 4 to 5 batches until finely chopped and semi-smooth but still chunky, but don’t over-blend it into a puree. You may have to stop and use a spoon to mix things around to get it to blend evenly. If you must, you can add a few teaspoons of water to each batch to help it blend. ","3. Transfer the sofrito into ice cube trays to freeze for later use. ","4. Can be frozen up to 6 months. Refrigerate up to 7 days."]
933.title: Puerto Rican Sofrito

934.ingredients: [1 seedless cucumber, peeled and diced, 2 medium ripe tomatoes, diced, 2 hass avocados, diced, 15.5 oz can black beans, rinsed and drained, 2 tbsp red onion, minced, 2 tbsp cilantro, minced, 2 limes, juice of, salt and fresh pepper, to taste]
934.recipe: ["1. Combine all the ingredients and season with salt and pepper to taste. ","2. Keep refrigerated until ready to serve."]
934.title: Black Bean, Avocado, Cucumber and Tomato Salad

935.ingredients: [6 large or 7 medium ears of corn, 6 cups, 1/4 cup chopped scallions, 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, 1/2 cup queso Cotija, crumbled, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, 1 teaspoon Tajin, Chili Lime Seasoning or Trader Joes Everything But the Elote seasoning, plus more for topping, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, lime wedges, optional for serving]
935.recipe: ["1. Set the grill to medium-high. Husk the corn.","2. Grill 10 to 12 minutes, turning often, until charred in spots. Transfer to a cutting board and set aside to cool. ","3. Cut the kernels off the cobb. Put the corn, scallions and cotija cheese in a medium salad bowl. Drizzle with the olive oil and toss.","4. Add the tajin (chili lime seasoning), cilantro and toss again. Taste for salt and pepper and adjust as needed.","5. Serve topped with more chili lime seasoning and fresh lime wedges if desired."]
935.title: Mexican-Inspired Grilled Corn Salad with Cotija

936.ingredients: [1 ripe mango, peeled and diced, 5 ounces diced avocado, from 1 medium haas, 1 plum tomato, diced, 1 clove garlic, minced, 1 jalapeño, seeded and diced, 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro, 2 tbsp fresh lime juice, 1/4 cup chopped red onion, 1/2 tbsp olive oil, kosher salt and fresh pepper to taste]
936.recipe: ["1. Combine all the ingredients and let it marinate in the refrigerator 30 minutes before serving."]
936.title: Avocado Mango Salsa

937.ingredients: [2 cups uncooked long grain rice, 4 teaspoon olive oil, 1 large chicken or veggie bouillon cube, such as knorrs or maggi, 5 medium scallions, chopped, 2 garlic cloves, minced, 1 medium tomato, diced, 1/2 cup chopped cilantro, 4 cups water, 1 packet  Badia Sazon seasoning*, or see my homemade sazon recipe, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, or more to taste]
937.recipe: ["1. In a medium heavy pot with a tight fitting lid, heat oil on medium heat and saute scallions, cilantro and garlic for about 2 minutes, until tender,","2. Add the tomatoes and saute another minute, until they get soft. ","3. Add rice and saute 2 minutes longer, stirring frequently. ","4. Add water, bouillon cube, sazón plus 1 teaspoon salt.","5. Taste 4 cups water and taste for salt, it should be flavorful and salty enough, adjust as needed.","6. Let the water boil on a high heat stirring once at this point.","7. As the water boils down and just barely skims the top of the rice, reduce heat to very low and cover 15 minutes.","8. The steam will cook the rice so do not open the lid.","9. After 15 minutes, shut the flame off and let it sit at least 5 more minutes without touching the lid. ","10. The steam will finish cooking the rice without burning the bottom. Then fluff with a fork and enjoy."]
937.title: Latin Yellow Rice

938.ingredients: [1 1/2 cups cooked quinoa, red or tricolor, 8 ounces haas avocado, from 2 small, diced, juice of 1 lime, 1 ripe beefsteak or heirloom tomato, diced, 2 mini cucumbers, diced, 1/3 cup chopped cilantro, 1/3 cup chopped red onion, 1 jalapeño, sliced thin with seeds, 1 teaspoon extra virgin olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste]
938.recipe: ["1. Combine all the ingredients together in a bowl and eat right away.","2. Taste for salt and lime juice, and adjust as needed.","3. If meal prepping, combine all the ingredients except for the avocado, and add when ready to eat. ","4. Multiply the recipe for more servings."]
938.serving: 2 servings as a main, 4 as a side
938.title: Avocado Quinoa Salad

939.ingredients: [2 cups de-stemmed and chopped kale, 2 teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil, 1/8 teaspoon kosher salt, 4 medium  sweet potatoes, peeled and quartered lengthwise (28 oz peeled), 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 1 teaspoon chili powder, 1 teaspoon chipotle powder, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, ½ teaspoon ground coriander, ½ teaspoon garlic powder, 1 cup plain 0% Greek yogurt, or dairy-free yogurt for vegan or DF, 1 chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, 2 tablespoons lime juice, 2 cloves garlic, peeled, Kosher salt, 1 15-ounce can  black beans, drained and rinsed, 2 cups cooked brown rice, 4 ounces avocado, from 1 small pitted, peeled, and diced, 1 cup Quick-Pickled Red Onions, 1 cup fresh cilantro leaves, 1 lime, sliced into wedges]
939.recipe: ["1. Place the kale, olive oil, and salt in a bowl. Massage the kale for 1 minute. It will shrink in volume. ","2. Let sit at room temperature while making the rest.","1. Preheat the oven to 400°F with a rack placed in the center of the oven.","2. While the oven preheats, place the peeled and quartered sweet potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with water.","3. Bring to a boil over high heat. Boil the sweet potatoes just until the edges give a bit to pressure from a fork, about 8 minutes. You don’t want to overcook them, or they could turn mushy.","4. Drain the sweet potatoes and pat dry with a paper towel then cut them into bite-sized pieces.","5. In a large bowl, toss the sweet potatoes with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil.","6. In a small bowl, mix together the salt, chili powder, chipotle powder, cumin, coriander, and garlic powder.","7. Sprinkle the spice blend onto the sweet potatoes and toss to evenly coat.","8. Scatter the sweet potatoes on a sheet pan and roast for 15 to 20 minutes, flipping once halfway through, until browned and fork-tender. ","1. Place the yogurt, chipotle pepper, lime juice, garlic cloves, and a pinch of salt in a blender or small food processor. Blend or process until smooth. ","2. Season to taste with salt. Set aside until ready to assemble the bowls, or store in the refrigerator.","1. Fill serving bowls with the kale, roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, brown rice, and avocado.","2. Garnish with the pickled red onions, creamy chipotle sauce, and cilantro. Serve with lime wedges."]
939.title: Roasted Sweet Potato Black Bean Bowls

940.ingredients: [Cooking spray, 1 teaspoon olive oil, ½ onion, diced small, 1 medium  Yukon Gold potato, about 8 ounces, diced small, 1 jalapeño, halved, 1 teaspoon chili powder, ½ teaspoon smoked paprika, 1 cup grated Pepper Jack or Colby Jack cheese, 5 large  eggs, ⅔ cup 2% milk, ¼ cup half-and-half, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, Your favorite toppings, like salsa, chopped cilantro, and sliced avocado]
940.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Spray a pie dish with oil and set it aside.","2. Slice half of the jalapeno in thin slices, dice the remaining removing the seeds.","3. In a small skillet over medium heat, add the olive oil.","4. Saute the onion and potato for about 5 minutes, until they’re starting to soften.","5. Add the minced jalapeño, chili powder, smoked paprika to the pan and sauté for another 30 seconds to 1 minute, until fragrant. ","6. Spread the cooked vegetables in an even layer in the pie plate.","7. In a mixing bowl, whisk the eggs to break them up, then add the milk, half and half and salt.","8. Pour the custard into the pie dish, and sprinkle the cheese all over.","9. Top with jalapeno slices and bake for 35 to 40 minutes, just until the center is set.","10. Cut the quiche into 6 slices and serve."]
940.title: Crustless Potato Jalapeño Quiche

941.ingredients: [1 tsp oil, 1 small onion, diced, 2 medium vine tomatoes, diced, 1/4 cup canned chopped green chiles, such as Old El Paso, olive oil spray, kosher salt and black pepper, 1/8 teaspoon cumin, 4 6 inch  corn tortillas, 4 large eggs, 1/2 cup shredded lettuce, 4 tbsp crumbled cotija cheese, or queso blanco, 2 tbsp chopped cilantro]
941.recipe: ["1. Heat oil in a medium pan. Add onions and cook until soft, 2 to 3 minutes. Add tomatoes, green chilies, cumin, salt and black pepper to taste and cook another few minutes. Set aside and keep warm. ","2. In another medium non-stick pan or griddle, lightly spray the tortillas with oil on both sides and heat over medium-high heat until the tortillas gets crispy and pockets or air bubbles start to form inside, abour 1 to 2 minutes on each side. Set aside. ","3. Reduce heat to medium-low and lightly spray with more oil, add eggs, salt and pepper. Cover and cook until the whites set for sunny-side up or longer for your liking.","4. To serve, place 2 tortillas on each plate, top with half of the tomatoes, 2 eggs, lettuce, cheese and cilantro."]
941.title: Huevos Rancheros

942.ingredients: [1 1/4 tablespoon cumin, 1 1/4 tablespoon chili powder, 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon onion powder, 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 3/4 cup Stonyfield Organic whole milk plain yogurt, 2 15 oz cans black beans, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 medium onion, chopped, 1 red bell pepper, chopped, 1 diced jalapeno, plus more for garnish, 10 oz can rotel tomatoes with green chilies, 8 ounces frozen corn, 8 ounce can tomato sauce, 3/4 cup less-sodium vegetable broth, Optional Toppings: shredded cheddar, diced red onions, cilantro, diced avocado]
942.recipe: ["1. Mix the spices in a small bowl. Set aside 1 1/2 teaspoons and mix into the yogurt. Set aside.","2. Place 1 can of beans, not drained in the blender with 1/2 cup of water and puree. Drain the second can.","3. Add oil to a large pot over medium heat, add the onions, bell pepper and jalapeno and cook 3 to 4 minutes.","4. Add tomatoes, corn, beans, pureed beans, tomato sauce, vegetable broth and remaining spices. ","5. Bring to a boil, cover and simmer about 15 minutes, stirring until thickened. ","6. Serve topped with spiced yogurt plus your favorite optional toppings."]
942.title: Easy Black Bean Vegetarian Chili with Spiced Yogurt

943.ingredients: [4 cups cauliflower florets, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon Tajin, 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 6 street taco size tortillas, I used Mr Tortilla low carb, pickled red onions, for topping (see below), 6 tablespoons Peruvian Green Sauce, for topping, sour cream, optional, cilantro, for garnish, 1 red onion, peeled and sliced into rounds, 1/2 cup apple cider vinegar, 1/3 cup water, 1 tablespoon cane sugar or maple, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 2 bay leaves]
943.recipe: ["1. In a medium bowl combine the cauliflower, olive oil, Tajin, smoked paprika and salt.","2. Spray the air fryer basket with oil and add the cauliflower, cook 400F 12 to 15 minutes until browned and tender, shaking the basket halfway.","1. In a small saucepan heat the vinegar, water, sugar and salt until it boils and the sugar dissolves.","2. Transfer onions to a heat safe bowl with the bay leaves and pour liquid over the onions.","3. Set aside to cool then transfer to a glass jar and refrigerate overnight. "]
943.title: Air Fryer Roasted Cauliflower Tacos

944.ingredients: [2 tsp olive oil, 1/2 cup chopped green bell pepper, chopped, 1/2 cup chopped red bell pepper, chopped, small onion, chopped, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 cup uncooked long grain rice, 15 oz can black beans, I use Goya (don't drain), 1 1/2 cups water, 1/2 tsp cumin, 1 bay leaf, pinch oregano, salt and pepper to taste]
944.recipe: ["1. In a heavy medium sized pot, heat oil on medium heat.","2. Add onions, peppers and garlic and saute until soft, about 4-5 minutes.","3. Add rice, beans, water, cumin, bay leaf, oregano and salt and pepper. Simmer on medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until the rice absorbs most of the water and just barely skims the top of the rice. ","4. Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 20 minute (don't peek).","5. Make sure you have a good seal on your cover, the steam cooks the rice. After 20 minutes, shut flame off and let it sit, covered another 5 minutes (don't open the lid)."]
944.title: Arroz Congri (Cuban Rice and Black Beans)

945.ingredients: [4 medium ripe tomatoes, chopped, 1/2 cup finely chopped white onion, 1-2 jalapeño or serrano pepper, seeded and finely chopped, 1/4 cup finely chopped fresh cilantro leaves, no stems, 2 tbsp fresh lime juice, kosher salt and pepper, to taste, 2 tbsp chopped red bell pepper, (optional), 1 clove garlic, minced (optional)]
945.recipe: ["1. In a bowl combine all ingredients.","2. Let it marinate in the refrigerator at least an hour for best results."]
945.title: Pico de Gallo Salsa

946.ingredients: [2 tsp olive oil, 1/2 onion, 2 cloves garlic, 2 scallions, 2 tbsp red bell pepper, 3 tbsp cilantro, 15 oz can black beans, do not drain (I prefer Goya), 1/2 cup water, or more if needed, 1 bay leaf, few pinches cumin, to taste, pinch oregano, 1 tsp red wine vinegar, salt and black pepper to taste]
946.recipe: ["1. Chop onion, garlic, scallions, red pepper, and cilantro in a mini chopper of food processor.","2. Add oil to a medium-sized pot on medium heat.","3. Add vegetables to the pot and saute until soft, about 3 minutes.","4. Add beans, water, bay leaf, cumin, oregano, red wine vinegar, salt and black pepper and bring to a boil.","5. Lower heat and cover, simmer about 15 minutes stirring occasionally (adjust water as needed).","6. Taste for salt and serve."]
946.title: Quick and Delicioso Cuban Style Black Beans

947.ingredients: [1 lb dried red kidney beans, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 6 cloves crushed garlic, 1 tablespoon tomato paste, 1/4 bunch cilantro sprigs, 1 red onion, cut into 8 pieces, 1 cubanelle pepper, cut in 4 pieces, 2 chicken bouillon cubes, I use Maggi (or veggie for vegetarian), 1 1/2 teaspoons adobo seasoning, kosher salt, or to taste, white rice, for serving (not counted in macros)]
947.recipe: ["1. Put beans in the pressure cooker or Instant Pot and cover them with water so there’s 2 inches over them (10 cups). ","2. Soak overnight, but don’t drain.","3. Next day, cover and seal the pressure cooker (or Instant Pot) over medium heat, when the pot comes to pressure cook high pressure 20 minutes. Natural release.","4. While the pressure releases, in a large skillet, heat oil over medium-low heat and add garlic, tomato paste, cilantro, red onion, pepper, bouillon cube and saute about 10 minutes, stirring. ","5. Open the pressure cooker when the steam releases, take 25% of the beans and liquid and transfer to the blender. Puree well then return to the pot.  ","6. Add adobo seasoning and salt (about 1 teaspoon), or to taste. ","7. Add the sauteed vegetables to the beans and bring to a boil over medium heat. (In the Instant Pot use the saute button.) ","8. Boil uncovered over medium-low heat until the texture becomes creamy and the liquid reduces, about 30 minutes stirring often.  ","9. Remove cilantro, pepper and onion and serve over rice. Makes 9 cups."]
947.title: Dominican Beans (Habichuelas Guisadas)

948.ingredients: [1 garlic clove, finely chopped, 1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil, 1 lb zucchini, diced, 1 large tomato, cored, seeded and diced, 1 green onion, thinly sliced, 1 tbsp minced fresh cilantro, 1 tsp minced pickled jalapeño, 1/2 cup crumbled queso blanco, or queso fresco, cotija or feta, fresh lime juice, to taste, salt, to taste, freshly ground black pepper, to taste]
948.recipe: ["1. Cook the garlic in oil in a large skillet over medium heat 1 minute, stirring until sizzling.","2. Add zucchini and cook stirring occasionally, about 3 minutes or until slightly softened.","3. Add the tomato and green  onion and cook about 3 minutes.","4. Remove skillet from heat and add cilantro, jalapeño and lime juice.","5. Season with salt and pepper to taste and top with queso blanco. Serve hot."]
948.title: Skillet Mexican Zucchini

949.ingredients: [1 tablespoon olive oil, ½ small yellow onion, diced, 1 garlic clove, minced, 1 15-ounce can black beans, drained and rinsed, ½ teaspoon cumin, ¼ teaspoon smoked paprika, 1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper, ½ teaspoon kosher salt, Freshly ground black pepper, to taste, 1 tablespoon tomato paste, 1 tablespoon water, 8 hard corn taco shells, I like Old El Paso Stand ‘n Stuff, 4 ounces Hass avocado, from 1 small, Juice from 1/2 small lime, Pinch kosher salt, Freshly ground black pepper, to taste, ½ cup shredded cheddar cheese, 1 plum tomato, diced, 1 cup shredded romaine lettuce]
949.recipe: ["1. Preheat oven according to taco shell package directions. Lay taco shells on a sheet pan in an even layer. When hot, bake shells for 6-7 minutes. ","2. Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the canola oil, swirl to cover pan then add the onion and sauté 2-3 minutes until onions have softened and become translucent.  ","3. Add the garlic and sauté 30 seconds more. Add the beans, spices, tomato paste and water and mix until combined. ","4. Cook about 3 minutes to allow flavors to meld and beans to heat through.","5.
